category: Safety and Health Management Regulations/Article 19 (Special Safety and Health Education)
contents: Article 19 (Special Safety and Health Training) ① If the Chairman of the Board intends to have workers engage in harmful or dangerous work that falls under subparagraph 1, subparagraph 1 of Table 4 of the Enforcement Rules of the Industrial Safety Act, they must provide special safety and health training related to the work in question. Health education (hereinafter referred to as *special education) must be provided, and the training time shall be in accordance with the following items: 1. Daily workers: 2 hours or more, 2. Other than daily workers: 16 hours or more, 3. Workers other than daily workers In the case of short-term work or intermittent work: 2 hours or more, ② The contents of special training shall follow Item 1, Item 1 of Table 5 of the Enforcement Rules of the Industrial Safety Act. ③ In the case of special training, Article 29, Paragraph 2 of the Industrial Safety Act shall be provided to the relevant worker. In accordance with the provisions of this paragraph, training is deemed to have been provided upon hiring and when changing work details.
